column5: Omg lol! Well by then she wasnâ€™t too good so I kinda had no choice!
I remember id started out on Norco and when my doc gave me these instead I was pissed. That changed quickly. lol. The thing with hydrocodone is that it only lasts a few hours. Meh.

My first love. It was nice and warm and lasted for HOURS. But eventually the tolerance built until I got into dosages where seizures could happen and that was that. I took a full year away from them and the tolerance was still right there. I feel nothing from them now.

My mom was a fall risk and had one. I had a camera in the house so I could check on her when I was at work. I saw her walking around without it and called her.

My doc prescribed me Seroquel but Iâ€™m not taking it. I just donâ€™t want to take 4 different meds, esp adding one that can really cause weight gain if you arenâ€™t careful. Now mind you, Iâ€™d rather be fat and stable than thin and losing my mind. But I just donâ€™t want another thing in my body. 3 is enough. 

I think what got me thinking is that I was fine on the effexor and the other two were added after my mom died. Like, perhaps as time goes on, maybe I can get back to just the effexor and see how that is. Iâ€™ve only been having phone calls with my doc but once we are face to face I might ask her. Just to satisfy my curiosity. But I know Iâ€™ll never risk my stable mind.

I really do have this view in my heart. For me, meds keep me functioning, at least on a base level. Which I need bc I donâ€™t have the â€˜luxuryâ€™ to go off the rails when I need to keep a job and pay the bills, etc.
I get that. Iâ€™m a writer. Iâ€™m not book published, but you know how it is. You look at life as a writer. You always have the urge to write but never do. I miss being creative.

Motivated. A little excited at things. Just not being â€˜mehâ€™. Now, Iâ€™m dealing with grief at the moment so of course itâ€™s extra muted and Iâ€™d be suicidal without my meds. I know that. I want to be able to sit down and write. I want to read a book without my mind racing. I want to have ambition in my career. I guess typing all that out helped. Itâ€™s good to have that list and Iâ€™m going to write it down. Perhaps I can tackle one at a time. Thank you for the good question!
